details.body:
An employee fails to qualify for full foreign service exemption under [EIM13690](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13690). There is, however, some foreign service during the employment, so the foreign service reduction in [EIM13700](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13700) is considered. An employee receives a termination payment within Section 401 ITEPA 2003 of £100,000. To calculate the foreign service reduction, the first step is find the amount charged to tax (or, more accurately, the amount that would otherwise count as employment income, see [EIM13700](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13700)), as follows:
Termination payments and benefits within Section 401 ITEPA 2003£100,000
Threshold (see [EIM13505](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM12800#EIM13505))£30,000
Amount charged to tax£70,000
The reduction is then calculated using the £70,000 figure, see example [EIM13985](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM13985).
